Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Vatican \Vat"i*can\, n. [L. Vaticanus, mons, or collis, Vaticanus, the Vatican hill, in Rome, on the western bank of the Tiber: cf. F. Vatican, It. Vaticano.] A magnificent assemblage of buildings at Rome, near the church of St. Peter, including the pope's palace, a museum, a library, a famous chapel, etc. [1913 Webster]
Note: The word is often used to indicate the papal authority. [1913 Webster]
{Thunders of the Vatican}, the anathemas, or denunciations, of the pope. [1913 Webster]
Vatican n : the residence of the Catholic Pope in the Vatican City [syn: {Vatican Palace}]
